author: mini_mads1980
title: Clemmons Makes A Strong Debut
review:
Overview

Clemmons makes his debut attached to the front of the Lego City Comic in issue 31 and comes with a great looking ATV.  In the UK it was priced £4.25 and was on sale between 09 September and 06 October 2020.  This is the fifth fire related comic set, meaning fire is second most popular behind police in the total number of sets given with the City comics.

Packet

The front of the foil packet has a great inset image of Clemmons holding onto a white fire extinguisher.  He is also pictured riding his quad bike along a city road, racing to get to a fire.  The front indicates that this is for 5+, which is probably a little high although the closest comparable set from 2020 is also set at that age point [60247].

On the back, along with the standard safety information, is a 1:1 image of his bright red fireman helmet.

Minifigure

As this is Clemmons' first appearance as a solid minifigure on the front of the comic it is a little disappointing that he is not unique.  His appearance is exactly as the Forest Fire set 60247.  However, he is unique to only these two sets.

His torso is the only part that is printed on both sides.  This is fine as the helmet would not cover another facial expression, and he looks great exactly how he is.

The parts that make up Clemmons are as follows:

  • Helmet - Bright Red Mini Fireman Helmet [6248066]
  • Head - Bright Yellow Mini Head No 3119 [6290549]
  • Torso - Black Mini Upper Part No 4594 [6254472]
  • Legs - Black Mini Lower Part No 408 [6143335]

The bright red helmet was introduced in 2019 and appears in nine City sets.  The torso is only in four City sets and one Spider-Man set, so is still relatively rare.  It is similar to older ones however.

Appearing in 31 sets the legs are quite common, but as would be expected with a named character, his head is only in three sets other than here.  Two are City Fire sets that state Clemmons, but the other is the Haunted House [10273].  Maybe it was Clemmons' day off and he went for a day out.

Main Build / Parts

The build is easy enough and is made from 26 parts, and constructed quickly in 12 steps.  The quad bike looks great and I really like the cool yellow / bright red colour scheme that the fire sets currently have.  The rarest parts have to be the Racers Guard 2.5 x 4 [6291789] in Cool Yellow as they only appear in the Fire Helicopter Response set [60248], which unfortunately had one of the pull cord helicopters that were a big miss for me.

All other parts are quite easy to obtain should you wish to.  As this is a comic set you don't get any extra parts once built.  Unfortunately however there is no fire included for Clemmons to put out.  Just a 2X2 jumper plate with a flame attached would have added playability to the set.

Verdict

This is a really good little set and ideal for the comic line.  It falls fractionally short of five stars from me for a couple of minor reasons.  I didn't mention it above, but you don't get a hair element for Clemmons and the inclusion of some kind of fire to battle would have added to the set.  If used with other fire themed sets it will look perfect.

Next up is a bright orange motorbike and Pete Python.  He appears to be a private detective, so not exactly another police themed set, but close.  So far 9 out of the 31 comic sets have been police.
